analyzeResult.content:
. 1982, 204, 1146-1147
Aluminophosphate Molecular Sleves: A New Class of Microporous Crystalline Inorganic Solide
Stephen T. Wilson,. Brent M. Lok, Celeste A. Messina, Thomas R. Cannan, and Edith M. Flanigen"
Union Carbide Corporation, Tarrytown Technical Center Tarrytown, New York 10591 Received October 27, 1981
A novel class of crystalline, microporous, aluminophosphate phases has been discovered that represents the first family of framework oxide molecular sieves synthesized without silica. The most widely known molecular sieves are the aluminosilicate zoolites' and the microporous silica polymorphs.2 The novel aluminophosphate molecular sieves are similar to zeolites in some properties and may find many uses as adsorbents for separations of molecular species and as catalysts or catalyst supports.
The new family of aluminophosphate materials (AIPO2-n)' currently includes about 20, three-dimensional framework structures, of which at least 14 are microporous and 6 are two- dimensional layer-type materials. Most of the three-dimensional structures are novel; however, three appear to be structurally related to the zeolite family, with framework topologies of the erionite/offretite type (AIPO2-17), the sodalite type (AIPO,-20). and the analcime type (AIPO4-24).' One of the novel three-di- mensional structures, that of AIPO4-5, has been determined by single-crystal X-ray methods.4 AIPO2-5 has hexagonal symmetry with a = 1.372 nm and e = 0.847 am and contains one-dimensional channels oriented parallel to the c axis and bounded by 12- membered rings composed of alternating AlO, and PO, tetrahedra. It has the framework topology of the hypothetical 4-connected three-dimensional net no. 81 (4.6.12) proposed by Smith.S
The novel materials are synthesized hydrothermally at 100-250 *C from reaction mixtures containing an organic amine or que- ternary ammonium salt (R) which becomes entrapped or clath- rated within the crystalline products of composition: xR.AJ,02-(1.0 Â±0.2)P,OgyH2O. The quantities x and y represent the amounts needed to fill the microporous voids within the neutral AIPO. framework. The species R appears to fulfill an essential templating or structure-directing role in the synthesis of these novel micro- porous phases since without R deme AIPO, structures or known hydrates, AIPOyaH2O, form.
The direct relationship between a templating agent and the resulting structure is illustrated in the synthesis of AIPO -- 17, with a proposed erionite framework topology, by using quinuclidine, neopentylamine, or cyclohexylamine. In cach case chemical analysis corresponds to two template molocules per large cavity. Model building experiments indicate that (1) the three templating agents are similar in size, (2) two template molecules cesentially fill the large cavity, and (3) there are no further voids in the crionita-type structure of sufficient volume de contra templates. Similarly, tetreffhylammonite !! (TMAOH) templates the AIPO-20 jodelite framages with a template stoickiomnetry Sur 1 per voilakto cof spherical TMAOH molecule, with a 0.42-am dieser, fie into the sodalite cage.
Some structures are much Jom Template specific. AIPO,-5 cm be synthesized with 23 different anies and quaternary amino compounds. The large one-dimensional cylindrion] pore syflash perhaps imposes fewer constraints on the tompiste fit. Boone of the neutrality of the AIPO, network, the template is not needed as a charge-balancing agent; therefore, its incorporation into the structure is more a function of its size and shape relative to the channel volume to be filled.
(!) "sack, D. W. "Zeottie Molecule Save": Wiley: New York, 1974. (2) Per cuunais, along: U.S. Powit 406) 724, 1977. BONNE, J. M .; Grass. R. W. CIAm, J. P .; Patten, R. L. Kich 20, J. V. Nature 1974. 271, 512-326.
() Calma. J. P .: Bennett, J. M., 14 be submitted For publication. (5) amiti, J. V. Am. Mineral. 1978, 63, 960-969.
C 1962 American Chemical Society
2075004438

Microporous Crystalline Inorganic Solide
Stephen T. Wilson,. Brent M. Lok, Celeste A. Messina,
Thomas R. Cannan, and Edith M. Flanigen"
Union Carbide Corporation, Tarrytown Technical Center
Tarrytown, New York 10591

A novel class of crystalline, microporous, aluminophosphate

zoolites' and the microporous silica polymorphs.2 The novel
aluminophosphate molecular sieves are similar to zeolites in some
properties and may find many uses as adsorbents for separations
of molecular species and as catalysts or catalyst supports.

currently includes about 20, three-dimensional framework
structures, of which at least 14 are microporous and 6 are two-
dimensional layer-type materials. Most of the three-dimensional
structures are novel; however, three appear to be structurally
related to the zeolite family, with framework topologies of the
erionite/offretite type (AIPO2-17), the sodalite type (AIPO,-20).
and the analcime type (AIPO4-24).' One of the novel three-di-
mensional structures, that of AIPO4-5, has been determined by
single-crystal X-ray methods.4 AIPO2-5 has hexagonal symmetry
with a = 1.372 nm and e = 0.847 am and contains one-dimensional
channels oriented parallel to the c axis and bounded by 12-
membered rings composed of alternating AlO, and PO, tetrahedra.
It has the framework topology of the hypothetical 4-connected

ternary ammonium salt (R) which becomes entrapped or clath-
rated within the crystalline products of composition: xR.AJ,02-(1.0

needed to fill the microporous voids within the neutral AIPO.
framework. The species R appears to fulfill an essential templating
or structure-directing role in the synthesis of these novel micro-
porous phases since without R deme AIPO, structures or known
hydrates, AIPOyaH2O, form.

templates. Similarly, tetreffhylammonite !!
(TMAOH) templates the AIPO-20 jodelite framages
with a template stoickiomnetry Sur 1 per voilakto cof
spherical TMAOH molecule, with a 0.42-am dieser, fie
into the sodalite cage.

be synthesized with 23 different anies and quaternary amino

perhaps imposes fewer constraints on the tompiste fit. Boone
of the neutrality of the AIPO, network, the template is not needed

Stephen T. Wilson,. Brent M. Lok, Celeste A. Messina, Thomas R. Cannan, and Edith M. Flanigen"
Union Carbide Corporation, Tarrytown Technical Center Tarrytown, New York 10591 Received October 27, 1981

The most widely known molecular sieves are the aluminosilicate zoolites' and the microporous silica polymorphs.2 The novel aluminophosphate molecular sieves are similar to zeolites in some properties and may find many uses as adsorbents for separations of molecular species and as catalysts or catalyst supports.

The new family of aluminophosphate materials (AIPO2-n)' currently includes about 20, three-dimensional framework structures, of which at least 14 are microporous and 6 are two- dimensional layer-type materials. Most of the three-dimensional structures are novel; however, three appear to be structurally related to the zeolite family, with framework topologies of the erionite/offretite type (AIPO2-17), the sodalite type (AIPO,-20). and the analcime type (AIPO4-24).' It has the framework topology of the hypothetical 4-connected three-dimensional net no. 81 (4.6.12) proposed by Smith.S

The novel materials are synthesized hydrothermally at 100-250 *C from reaction mixtures containing an organic amine or que- ternary ammonium salt (R) which becomes entrapped or clath- rated within the crystalline products of composition: xR.AJ,02-(1.0 Â±0.2)P,OgyH2O. The quantities x and y represent the amounts needed to fill the microporous voids within the neutral AIPO. framework. The species R appears to fulfill an essential templating or structure-directing role in the synthesis of these novel micro- porous phases since without R deme AIPO, structures or known hydrates, AIPOyaH2O, form.

The direct relationship between a templating agent and the resulting structure is illustrated in the synthesis of AIPO -- 17, with a proposed erionite framework topology, by using quinuclidine, neopentylamine, or cyclohexylamine. (TMAOH) templates the AIPO-20 jodelite framages with a template stoickiomnetry Sur 1 per voilakto cof spherical TMAOH molecule, with a 0.42-am dieser, fie into the sodalite cage.

Some structures are much Jom Template specific. AIPO,-5 cm be synthesized with 23 different anies and quaternary amino compounds. The large one-dimensional cylindrion] pore syflash perhaps imposes fewer constraints on the tompiste fit. Boone of the neutrality of the AIPO, network, the template is not needed as a charge-balancing agent; therefore, its incorporation into the structure is more a function of its size and shape relative to the channel volume to be filled.
